alert.note: Alert for Shelby (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 21 at 11:31AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of West Tennessee, including the following county, Shelby. * WHEN...Until 1245 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1129 AM CDT, Heavy rainfall has come to an end across Shelby County, but runoff from earlier thunderstorms will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bartlett, Collierville, Germantown, Millington, Cordova, T O Fuller State Park, Memphis, Lakeland, Arlington, Ellendale, Southeast Memphis, Frayser, Midtown Memphis, Downtown Memphis, Eads, Whitehaven, Southwest Memphis, Piperton, Elmore Park and Raleigh. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
